intro: Brassica bivoniana, commonly known as the narrowleaf mustard, is a flowering plant in the family Brassicaceae. It is native to regions of Europe and parts of Asia, often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, featuring alternate, lance-shaped leaves and yellow flowers arranged in racemes. Its small, round seeds are dispersed by wind, contributing to its widespread distribution. The plant is known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in various soil conditions.
